data.title: Git: Provide overview of all changes in a commit

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,
I really like to have a *full* overview of my git commits I'm going to make.

Instead of just this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3246782/27348418-46c5a11a-55f4-11e7-8a9e-afe79dacde93.png)

I like to have an overview of all inline changes in one single page. That would be awesome!

data.title: feature-request: possibility to change the size of description popup
data.body:
Hello, I am creating a snippet for VS Code with long descriptions. I have noticed that the description popup window in VS Code has a scrollbar, but it would be greater if I can enlarge the window. This seems not to be possible in the current version (1.13.1). It would be better if one can either set the height and width in the preferences or change the size of the popup with mouse dynamically.

Regards steff

data.title: Rename Show Recommendations to Show all recommendations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Say I open a vue file. I get a notification recommending the Vetur extension with a button that says "Show Recommendations"

I click on it and a hundred recommendations show up.

As a user I was in the context of Vue, so I'd expect Vue related extensions to show up.
Now I need to search through the recommendations or do a lot of scrolling.

We should set the expectation up front that we intend to "Show **all** recommendations"

cc @Microsoft/vscode

data.title: Terminal middle click on Linux not working
data.body:
Middle click on Linux is meant to paste the selection (whether in the terminal or outside).

Upstream issue: https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/699

data.title: Emmet takes way too much disk space
data.body:
VS Code 1.12 for macOS was 188MB, while 1.13 is 235MB. That's a 25% increase of the overall size just for Emmet. The download itself grew from 63MB to 72MB.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22350/27346486-aebe4bac-55ed-11e7-966a-537ae95ecf30.png)

Although they are cool features, this seems like a very high price to pay for them.

Related to #28874 (I didn't want to hijack that one)

cc @Microsoft/vscode

data.title: wrong dpi for back arrow mouse cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10x64 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1. take tablet with high dpi resolution (pipo w1pro)
2. connect it to external monitor
3. setup tablet display dpi = 200%, but external monitor dpi = 100%
4. setup multi display setting to "Screen 2 only"
5. open any document in VSCode
6. move mouse pointer to document line numbers

Expected: mouse pointer in dpi = 100%

Actual: mouse pointer in dpi = 200%

In attachment you can see it. Steps recorder main window also has wrong dpi, as many other programs in this mode. But VSCode work almost excellent in this configuration => you can fix it or send request to Windows authors ;) I already sent similar report to Edge support and Screen driver support.

[vscode_cursor_wrong_dpi.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1088996/vscode_cursor_wrong_dpi.zip)

1. open a log file
2. open the search panel, search target. It can only find begin's 10000 items.

data.title: Editor model creation options do not honour folder scope yet
AccessibilityProvider getPosInSet and getSetSize
data.body:
An attempt to enrich the `Tree` `AccessibilityProvider` by adding optional `getPosInSet` and `getSetSize`. This fixes the https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/444 and gives all trees the option to opt into this

Note that it is not possible to solve this issue only in the QuickOpen world since QuickOpen does not have access to the proper dom element which should have this area attributes.


fixes #27900
fyi @alexandrudima

data.title: Enable language extensions to call emmet completion provider
data.body:
See https://github.com/octref/vetur/issues/232#issuecomment-309715449

In html files, we use the html parser to figure out the cursor is inside the style tag and then use css instead of html abbr

In non html files that need html like abbreviations, the parsing is not available out of the box and so the emmet extension doesn't realize to use css instead html abbr inside the html tag

Update:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29114#issuecomment-309840145 for a proposal that could solve this issue by passing the responsibility of figuring out scope to language specific extensions

data.title: Consider moving emmet completion provider for css to css language service

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In the new emmet, you get css abbreviations inside the <style> tag. But you get it **everywhere** inside the style tag including the selectors which is not valid.

Contents of <style> tag should be re-parsed as css to find valid locations for emmet abbr expansion

Or the emmet completion provider for css should be moved to the css language service

data.title: Lookahead and lookbehind don't work in sidebar search
data.body:
* VSCode Version: 1.13.1
* OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open sidebar search
2. Type in `cookie(?!s_and_cream)`
3. Witness!

![It's terrible!](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4363779/27339524-596a8568-55d8-11e7-9127-c7091ff76f94.png)

`(?=pamplemousse)`, `(?<=ananas)`, and `(?<!jus d'orange)` all have the same result. Unless I'm missing something, it simply seems like lookahead and lookbehind don't work in the sidebar.

data.title: Terminal doesn't react to shortcuts
data.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3399021/27339398-0f6a126c-55d8-11e7-94b1-c081b4a5ee84.png)
Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open terminal (Powershell)
2.  CTRL + v

or another example

1.  Open terminal (Powershell)
2.  npm start (run -> all ok)
3.  CTRL + c (to terminate, no reaction)

Everything used to work correctly but for some reason, no settings edited, terminal doesn't react to any CTRL + anything or any kind of shortcuts but if I type it works.

I am focused inside terminal because typing works

data.title: can you add ALT-SELECT ?
data.body:
In Visual Studio / Notepad++ / QtCreator, one can select text while pressing ALT, and this allows to grab a rectangle which doesn't start necessarily on the first column. I've seen that this feature is missing in VS Code (it instead just grabs everything from topleft first character through all the lines untile the last character. Can this feature be added ?

- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. load a text into Visual Studio Standard
2. highlight a rectangle of text whose top left corner is not on the first column
-> in Visual Studio it works.
3. load a text into VSCode
4. try highlighting a rectangle of text whose top left corner is not on the first column
-> in VSCode it doesn't work.

This is with the default Dark+ theme, although I can't find any of the built in themes that this works with.

data.title: Quick suggestions and emmet mismatch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

---

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open css file
2. Enter `pb`, press <kbd>tab</kbd>
3. Get `page-break-after: `
4. Press <kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>z</kbd>, then <kbd>tab</kbd>
5. Get `padding-bottom: ;`

![vscodesuggestionsemmetmismatch](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1856145/27335431-0980e694-55d5-11e7-92bb-97208997a00d.gif)

**What is the expected behavior?**
Items in quick suggest menu must be sorted in accordance with emmet.

data.title: getWordRangeAtPosition doesn't quite use the regex as expected
data.body:
I'm trying to use getWordRangeAtPosition to determine if the cursor is located within an inline block comment. It works fine unless the comment contains spaces.

From looking at extHostDocumentData.ts it looks like it selects a word first and then applies the regex to the word. The documentation suggests that the regex can be used to describe what a word is, but if I use **\/\*.+\*\/** to match anything in between the block comments it fails.

data.title: Vscode-insiders stopped respecting `typescript.tsdk` setting
data.body:
I have installed:
`vscode-insiders Version 1.14.0-insider (1.14.0-insider) 0b44bcd79af6783dff3fd9db4a9869c6de83c7bc`
and
`vscode Version 1.13.1 (1.13.1) 379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89`

They both have `User setting` containing `"typescript.tsdk": "/Users/normalser/.nvm/versions/node/v6.11.0/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib",`
and nothing in 'Workspace setting' (to cause the issue)

`vscode` works fine and picks up that version but `vscode-insiders` stopped using that value and is using built-in typescript (it worked before)

Here is screenshot from `vscode`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1723815/27333385-af730740-5593-11e7-900e-353fdd021f6e.png)

Here is screenshot from `vscode-insiders`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1723815/27333403-c0ec8898-5593-11e7-97a3-8489028723af.png)

data.title: Unable to open extension view.
data.body:
Error message: 
connect ENOENT /Users/Kun/.nvim/XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/Code - Insiders-1.14.0-insider-shared.sock

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders-1.14.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

This happened after I installed the latest update of insiders version last night(Chinese time), and it remains in today's release, but the latest stable version of VScode works fine, with the same configuration and extensions.

I have VSCodeVIM extension installed and with NEOVIM backend enabled, but previous version and stable version it works just fine.

data.title: Not localized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change display language to "ja"(any)
2. Click a git sync button in the status bar

`localize` points (secondary modules, in /extensions) do not work.

I guess they cannot get `nls.config(process.env.VSCODE_NLS_CONFIG)()`.

Example:

extensions/git/src/main.ts (has nls.config)
![inked863f6ddc36157e20498dbc62dbe523b3_li](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8474118/27330233-8f3fb404-55f3-11e7-9cfa-6f2fbb714517.jpg)

extensions/git/src/commands.ts (not work)
![inkedd147eccc09f515f06e7a69b9542b93e2_li](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8474118/27330216-77080c06-55f3-11e7-8ae4-f99daebd6770.jpg)

And, It seems that some Extensions(such, merge-conflict) have no `nls.config`.
